entry.title: Digestive contents and food webs record the advent of dinosaur supremacy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Digestive contents and food webs record the advent of dinosaur supremacy

Integrated analyses of bromalites provide robust pictures of past food webs, explaining early dinosaur evolution and the emergence of larger dinosaur faunas with new feeding patterns.

  • Martin Qvarnström
  • Joel Vikberg Wernström
  • Grzegorz Niedźwiedzki
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Soil microbiomes show consistent and predictable responses to extreme events (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Soil microbiomes show consistent and predictable responses to extreme events

Soils from 30 grasslands across Europe were subjected to 4 contrasting extreme climatic events under drought, flood, freezing and heat conditions, with the results suggesting that soil microbiomes from different climates share unified responses to extreme climatic events.

  • Christopher G. Knight
  • Océane Nicolitch
  • Franciska T. de Vries
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Study design features increase replicability in brain-wide association studies (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Study design features increase replicability in brain-wide association studies

Optimizing study design is critical for increasing standardized effect sizes and replicability, and the features that increase replicability in cross-sectional and longitudinal brain-wide association studies are explored.

  • Kaidi Kang
  • Jakob Seidlitz
  • Simon Vandekar
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Multiple mechanisms for licensing human replication origins (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Multiple mechanisms for licensing human replication origins

Biochemical and structural studies of the loading pathway of the human MCM2–7 replicative helicase motor reveal differences from the orthologous yeast system that may increase resilience against challenges faced by multicellular organisms.

  • Ran Yang
  • Olivia Hunker
  • Franziska Bleichert
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: MCM double hexamer loading visualized with human proteins (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
MCM double hexamer loading visualized with human proteins

Biochemical and structural studies of the human MCM replicative DNA helicase complex show differences from the yeast complex and provide insights into mechanisms of double hexamer assembly on sequence-independent replication origins.

  • Florian Weissmann
  • Julia F. Greiwe
  • Alessandro Costa
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Direct visualization of relativistic quantum scars in graphene quantum dots (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Direct visualization of relativistic quantum scars in graphene quantum dots

Using a graphene quantum dot creation and a wavefunction mapping technique, quantum scars are directly visualized for Dirac electrons with a scanning tunnelling microscope.

  • Zhehao Ge
  • Anton M. Graf
  • Jairo Velasco Jr
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Gut microbiota strain richness is species specific and affects engraftment (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Gut microbiota strain richness is species specific and affects engraftment

Strain richness of gut microbiota ecosystems is a key characteristic underpinning engraftment in faecal microbiota transplantation, and could improve the design of defined live biotherapeutic products with predictable outcomes.

  • Alice Chen-Liaw
  • Varun Aggarwala
  • Jeremiah J. Faith
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Early versus deferred use of CDK4/6 inhibitors in advanced breast cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Early versus deferred use of CDK4/6 inhibitors in advanced breast cancer

The phase 3 SONIA trial challenges the benefits of using cyclin-dependent kinase 4 and 6 inhibitors as a first-line compared with second-line treatment.

  • Gabe S. Sonke
  • Annemiek van Ommen-Nijhof
  • Christa van Schaik-van de Mheen
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Interleukin-15-armoured GPC3 CAR T cells for patients with solid cancers (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Interleukin-15-armoured GPC3 CAR T cells for patients with solid cancers

We evaluate the effects in humans of interleukin-15 co-expression on glypican-3 (GPC3) chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T cells and demonstrate that IL-15 increases the expansion, intratumoural survival and antitumour activity of GPC3 (expressed in a group of solid cancers) CAR T cells.

  • David Steffin
  • Nisha Ghatwai
  • Andras Heczey
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Organ-specific sympathetic innervation defines visceral functions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Organ-specific sympathetic innervation defines visceral functions

Multi-modal transcriptomic analyses of the sympathetic nervous system reveal organ-specific neural innervation and modular regulation of visceral functions.

  • Tongtong Wang
  • Bochuan Teng
  • Yuki Oka
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Cancer cells impair monocyte-mediated T cell stimulation to evade immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Cancer cells impair monocyte-mediated T cell stimulation to evade immunity

Inflammatory monocytes are identified as important players in T cell restimulation in the tumour microenvironment.

  • Anais Elewaut
  • Guillem Estivill
  • Anna C. Obenauf
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Stereochemistry in the disorder–order continuum of protein interactions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Stereochemistry in the disorder–order continuum of protein interactions

Studies on protein–protein interactions using proteins containing d- or l-amino acids show that stereoselectivity of binding varies with the degree of disorder within the complex.

  • Estella A. Newcombe
  • Amanda D. Due
  • Birthe B. Kragelund
ArticleOpen Access27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Pan-genome bridges wheat structural variations with habitat and breeding (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Pan-genome bridges wheat structural variations with habitat and breeding

The pan-genome of 17 wheat cultivars grown in China is explored, providing insights into the breeding history of wheat in East Asia.

  • Chengzhi Jiao
  • Xiaoming Xie
  • Xueyong Zhang
Article27 Nov 2024

entry.title: Fungal symbiont transmitted by free-living mice promotes type 2 immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Fungal symbiont transmitted by free-living mice promotes type 2 immunity

Kazachstania pintolopesii is a highly prevalent fungal symbiont that can trigger type 2 immunity and influence the composition of the gut mycobiome, as well as immune and disease phenotypes.

  • Yun Liao
  • Iris H. Gao
  • Iliyan D. Iliev

entry.content:

ggplot2
